website_summaries.verdict: Extremely comfortable, deceivingly lightweight, and strikingly stylish—these qualities easily describe the Caprock by Adidas. Thankfully, this celebrated hiking footwear doesn’t stop there; it is also powerfully grippy over mixed terrain and stands mightily durable against abuse and wear and tear. That said, this shoe’s reputation is by no means spotless as some users didn’t appreciate its subpar breathability. All in all, the Adidas Caprock “rocks” thanks to its harmonious combination of comfort, durability, and aesthetics. Hikers looking for an ultra-ventilated shoe, however, should very well opt for something else.
pros: To many Adidas customers, the Caprock is unequivocally unrivaled when it comes to comfort
Numerous wearers were deeply impressed with the shoe’s confidence-inspiring traction
Its grip, according to them, is simply relentless no matter the quality and type of terrain
The Caprock stunned a number of customers with its irresistible good looks and style
This Adidas hiking shoe greatly exemplifies sturdiness, based on a dozen of user reviews
According to quite a handful of owners, this hiking gear—despite its beefy profile—is surprisingly light
One of them even likened it to a pair of trail runners
Some wearers gave the Adidas Caprock accolades for its true-to-size fit
According to a moderate percentage of reviewers, this low-top hiker is satisfyingly versatile
They said that its function and performance are for office and casual uses as well
A handful of buyers commended this Adidas shoe for having not one but two switchable footbeds
A few owners happily reported that they were able to use their Caprocks straight out of the box with no pain or blisters
A couple of wearers found this shoe a great value for their money
cons: Based on a couple of user reviews, the Caprock could be a lot more breathable
Although roomy overall, this shoe still received some flak from a very small number of owners for its measly toe box space
On the support front, a couple of hikers didn’t feel like the shoe offered much

customer_reviews.title: Wide heel but great quality
customer_reviews.text: Shoe felt very well made, ran maybe a touch large. Had to return because the heel was too wide so my heel slipped all over the place just walking around my living room. Bummer, because seemed like a great shoe. The two sets of insoles were a particularly cool touch, since sometimes you want to wear thin athletic socks and sometimes you need thick hiking socks. Ah well, not the first great shoe my weird feet haven’t fit well (for reference, Keens are my best-fitting brand).
customer_reviews.author: hoshy

customer_reviews.title: I normally wear Merrels and these actually fit better. If you have a wider toe area and ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits well and a very durable shoe. I normally wear Merrels and these actually fit better. If you have a wider toe area and like the feeling of letting you fore foot spread out you will like these shoes. They are just wide without looking like you're wearing swimming fins.
customer_reviews.author: LeeT

customer_reviews.title: Stiff, not very flexible
customer_reviews.text: I really was hoping these would work for me. I am a city mail carrier and i walk 13.2 miles a day. They were loose fitting and did not flex well in the mid foot area. I could not handle much more as my feet felt as if they were on fire from fighting the stiffness of the shoe. Felt decent out of the box just standing but not on the streets.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny Workman

customer_reviews.title: Solid shoes - no arch support to speak of
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set of these. My only complaint is that the insoles are basically a flat tray, so if you want or need support, you will want to line up some insoles. That being said, with the right insoles, these shoes are great: durable, comfortable and tready but without pretense.insoles were a great pairing.
customer_reviews.author: Diyjon

customer_reviews.title: Very tough, great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These are great, I bought them because I wanted a rugged pair of hiking shoes for winter that did not cover the ankle, I have ankle boots as well but wanted more freedom of motion for less difficult walking trails. The soles are very hard and seem almost indestructible so I had to break them in by wearing them every odd day to work. Have had them for about a month now and they are great and fit perfect. Definitely recommend breaking them in slowly if you go on a long hike day one with these your feet are going to hurt. I love Adidas anyway and now planning a lighter mesh pair they offer for summer hiking.
customer_reviews.author: James Cormack

customer_reviews.title: Solid Shoe for Walking Around Rainy Seattle
customer_reviews.text: I got these shoes to handle the hills and puddles that are common in Seattle. I walk about an hour or so every day so it's important that these shoes work well for my commute. So far they have worked out great. I find myself slipping significantly less than I used to. I don't purposely walk through puddles but the few that I have stepped in have cause no problems. My only real negative is the looks. They are decent looking but not overly nice to look at. They look fine with a pair of jeans but they are nothing special.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: good but not great
customer_reviews.text: i can see that they look good. told they fit great and are confortable. only thing keeping it at 4 and not 5 stars is that you can tell some actual real wear and tear on these will tear them up in 3-4 months easy. these are bought for a more comfortable work shoe for someone who has to walk through construction zones often.
customer_reviews.author: BSBonner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing fit and NO BLISTERS!
customer_reviews.text: These hiking shoes are really amazing! I was a little critical on the fit but near perfect just the same. They are very comfortable and my first pair of low profile type hiking shoes. I’ve been wearing Timberlands hiking boots that are high profile to aid in protecting your ankles while hiking. I love em. But I wanted a change to something lighter and these are perfect. Best of all, on a long 8-mile hike it still feels great and no blisters! Hallelujah!!
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Too stiff not very snug to the foot
customer_reviews.text: Not a great shoe for avid hickers. This shoe although is made of very nice compound with great traction and grip does not flex well. Also the shoe does not fit great could be a bit deeper so the area around your ankles does feel like the shoe will pop off if you decide to jog on the trails or run. I have had much better hiking shoes i suggest trying to find one with a flex groove or just more flexible and higher at the ankle area.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are great general-use shoes. Not quite at the serious hiking level of higher end Adidas, Merrell, or Vasque, but not priced like those either. Agree with other reviews about the almost-too-roomy toebox and lack of arch support, but nothing worth taking a start off for, and if arch support is really a concern, you are going to want better insoles than anything in the same price/use-case range offers anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Huge 11
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size 11, but this particular model's 11 is way larger than any other 11's that I have ever owned. Will get in touch with customer support ant try to get a smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great All Terrain Hiking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Hiked through Jordan and Israel, shoes straight out of the box. Handled a variety of terrain, from desert to mountains extremely well. Rugged, comfortable,great fit for those with wide feet. Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mvass

customer_reviews.title: Good quality so far and no need to break-in
customer_reviews.text: These felt great out of the box, no stiffness. It's only been a couple weeks, but the quality seems good. The laces have come undone twice, that is my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: PCH

customer_reviews.title: Good looking shoe but has little to no arch support
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of the shoe. Others have written that the shoe is not roomy enough but I disagree. I wear a 9.5 in Asics running shoes. I need a 9 in this shoe. Also, there is almost no arch support. If you have normal to high arches, you will need to replace the insoles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice aggressive tread on the bottom
customer_reviews.text: Comfy, not too heavy to do light running, nice aggressive tread on the bottom. I'm very happy, for the price you'll have trouble finding something better
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Cimino

customer_reviews.title: Good $100 hiking shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to go up 1/2 size from my normal approach shoe size (11.5 from 11). These have a heavily padded tongue that's also gussetted, that probably adds some volume. The return was quick and easy through Amazon, and I had a nice fitting pair in 3 days. The heel cup may be a bit narrow at the bottom, the provided insoles (two sets), tend to bunch up towards the back. This may go away as I put miles on the shoe. The sole is grippy and stiff, they should hold up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon E. Beach

customer_reviews.title: Ran a little big for me
customer_reviews.text: Shoes were looser than normal. Thicker socks will help. Well packaged. They send a pair of insoles with them. Didn't seem to help with fit, but if you have a pair of shoes that squeak when you walk the new insoles take care of that problem. I stoped wearing the squeaky shoes (Adidas) After two times. Getting thosen insoles and this pair made it seem like I had received to new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Waterwall

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm very picky and I really love the shoe. Feels like a good quality shoe that is very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kidroxx

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but missing extra set of insole inserts.
customer_reviews.text: Shoes look great, nice alternative to boots or tennis shoes for standing/walking all day at work! They fit well, I always have to size up for Adidas - normally wear a 13 but ordered 14 and they fit well. Description included 2 sets of insoles - one thin & one thick. Only received the thin pair - Was looking forward to trying out the other set of insoles.
customer_reviews.author: Cox

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for work.
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up for work, I hate big bulky boots, these are great. I replaced the horrible insoles that I get in all my shoes. Holding up really well.
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: first pair of adidas
customer_reviews.text: i have a wide foot. the reviews stated fit well for wider feet. a little snug out of the box. but will be comfortable after broken in.
customer_reviews.author: Jason monnin

customer_reviews.title: This is my sons second pair --A+  Still has first pair.
customer_reviews.text: This is my sons second pair --A+ Bullet proof! He still has the first pair. Will not wear anything else. Good deal.
customer_reviews.author: CCrow

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable foot wear
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable foot wear. Can’t tell you anything about durability for I haven’t had them long enough but can’t see any reason why the wouldn’t be.
customer_reviews.author: Cinthia Andrade

customer_reviews.title: These are great shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are some of the most comfortable out of the box shoes I have ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: love this shoe
customer_reviews.text: I really love the shoe. Feels like a good quality shoe that is very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe - true fit for my foot which tends ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe - true fit for my foot which tends to run a little wide. Very firm sole, but I bet when theyre broken in they'll only grow in comfort. Edit: After I wore the knobs off the sole from hiking, they became my work shoe - nearly 2 years later and thousands of miles they're falling apart - these have been one of the best shoes in my LIFETIME. Im so sad they're discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: James Ferryman

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband he said they are really comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Debrah Little

customer_reviews.title: Caprock Gray
customer_reviews.text: Well made flexible-style hiking shoe that is light, yet durable. Have not tried them on the trail yet but have worn them. Very comfortable and fit to my size. Love the two sole insert option.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A Gloe

customer_reviews.title: Nice Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I little large closer to 11 than 10.5. Comfortable once you break then in a bit. Afraid the shoe will get even bigger when completely broken in.
customer_reviews.author: James A Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I ordered them for my boyfriend who refuses to buy new shoes. He likes them a lot
customer_reviews.author: brittany ferris

customer_reviews.title: Light and durable
customer_reviews.text: Good fit for my flat feet. Have used these to trek 20,000 step days around Disney for a week — and comfortably on hikes with a light pack (<20lbs)on nearby trails.
customer_reviews.author: J. August

customer_reviews.title: Wowowowowow
customer_reviews.text: Toss these bad boys right on your feet and hit the trails (with your feet)
customer_reviews.author: Norm Sousa

customer_reviews.title: They fit
customer_reviews.text: only used for 7 days. they feel secure, comfortable and tall. it makes me feel tall. I like the grip. very grippy.
customer_reviews.author: Jehily Bojorquez

customer_reviews.title: Spiderman
customer_reviews.text: I inspect homes and this show is perfect for all the terrain I encounter. Great trip for roofs!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Brinson

customer_reviews.title: Not up to standard
customer_reviews.text: Not much room in the toes. The insole is not up to adidas standards.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good show. Runs half size small. Get a larger size then you normally get.
customer_reviews.author: Kisauer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes, I took them out on a 12 mile hike they were very comfortable and held up well
customer_reviews.author: Mariano Ibanez

customer_reviews.title: Walking On Clouds.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a work shoe & this is just perfect.This one is built tough but not heavy at all.Very comfortable as well.
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: Adidas quality
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as they looked and were described, the reason for the 4 star is the laces. They are cheap/poor quality and will not last so I replaced them
customer_reviews.author: Cooper Carr

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Like the fit but the grey really looks more like a light purple.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Huizing

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Ordered my normal size and they fit as expected. Great shoe at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: TMA777

customer_reviews.title: too stiff
customer_reviews.text: Good quality shoe overall and seem durable. I go hiking alot on trails and rock, these shoes hurt my feet in about 15 minutes. Additionally if the rock is wet you are slipping. Very poor traction.
customer_reviews.author: S H

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I always get a good fit with Adidas. I like the styling and they are sturdy built
customer_reviews.author: William F. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: These are nice a snug. I think (once broken in) they will work well!
customer_reviews.author: R. Smythe

customer_reviews.title: Not true to size
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 12 D in every shoe. This one simply was not true to size. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K. Duce

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shoe
customer_reviews.text: My husband has worn these so many times. They are very comfortable and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Decent shoes, but heel is too wide
customer_reviews.text: Shoes seem to be OK, but heel is too wide and my foot slips out, had to return. I hope Adidas will bring back Supernova Trail.
customer_reviews.author: Think before u buy

customer_reviews.title: 4 season shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love love love. Works in summer and winter! Great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and come with two different insole, They have a solid structure
customer_reviews.author: Shai Harel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits good, feels good and has a great grip. I haven’t test it for drynes
customer_reviews.author: Rodolfo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for walking
customer_reviews.text: Perfect shoe. I’m a letter carrier with a walking route and these shoes are great. They fit true to size and are comfortable all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! Worth the money. Very comfortable and long lasting shoe
customer_reviews.author: Gunnedslingers

customer_reviews.title: Failed too soon
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and decent looking shoe. Unfortunately a tear developed after only several months and light, casual use. Not used for hiking or working. The soles also showed a significant amount of wear for the use they had.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good shoe. Fits as expected and seems that it will last a while. Does tend to get filthy in the Arizona terrain.
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN ST ANDRE

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes.
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable and come with two different insoles. Typically the big box stores in my area do not carry my size in Adidas brand shoes. Found them the day after on sale for 39.89. kept these though as Amazon has always done right by me and that's worth something.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: but it turned out to be better than i expected
customer_reviews.text: Had doubts about the shoe size and the model, but it turned out to be better than i expected. Really love my new Adidas Caprock...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: adidas outdoor mens AF6097 Caprock
product_meta.description: This best selling hiking shoe offers a soft suede leather upper combined with a high abrasion mesh upper for extra durability, enhanced comfort, and breathability. Two insoles are included for customizable regular or roomy fit. An adiPRENE insert for comfort and shock absorption. TRAXION outsole for maximum grip in all directions.
feature_bullets: Upper: Soft suede leather for enhanced comfort and breathability
Upper: High abrasion mesh upper for extra durability. Sandwich mesh lining with protective rubber toe cap
Midsole: adiPRENE insert for comfort and shock absorption
Sockliner: Two insoles included for regular and roomy fit
Outsole: TRAXION outsole for maximum grip in all directions
